intro: Corydalis solida subsp. vajdae, commonly known as the Kashmir corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant has slender, creeping stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
